What is your overall assessment of this course?

Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Introduction to algebraic geometry. We started by developing the theory of affine plane curves: algebraic sets, varieties, coordinate rings, local rings etc. Then proceeded to affine intersection theory to roughly finish the first half of the course. After that projective varieties were introduced and corresponding theory was developed. The big results from the class were the Bezout theorem and Riemann-Roch. This class helped me see the power of algebraic structures in describing geometries of curves.
basic algebraic geometry and many useful examples
General introduction to fundamentals of algebraic geometry, first (half) for affine spaces and then for projective

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Professor Shen is the biggest strength of the course by a country mile. His teaching is amazing!!! The material is also very good. I don't see how this class could be any better.

The course oassumed knowledge that the prereqs (350 and 310) didnt give youwe somewhat often relied on results from modern and commutative algebra, and we were either supposed to just know them or wed prove them very quickly as lemmas in class. I think this course should include modern as a prerequisite, although you can take it without, if youre willing to stretch yourself a bit or just assume some results without complete understanding.

That saidthe grading is super fair, the professor is really knowledgeable and encouraging, every class had its full notes posted on Canvas afterward so you could review them, and we generally followed the textbook pretty closely, so you could consult that if you got too lost.

That said,

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely take this course! Algebraic geometry is beautiful and professor Shen is great. He uses lots of examples to help build intuition and is extremely insightful. Not the highest workload (definitely not as intense as something like 305 with Minsky or 350 with Miki) but very rewarding. I walked out having learned stuff which cannot always be said about classes in the math dept.
Yes, interesting topic and very fair workload, just maybe have a more developed algebra background than just 350.
